respStmt.resp: Conversion to TEI based on earlier work for the ENRICH project (enrich@oucs.ox.ac.uk; http://tei.oucs.ox.ac.uk/ENRICH/)

recordHist.source:
Summary description by Elizabeth Solopova based on the Summary Catalogue and supplementary sources.
Summary Catalogue, vol. 4, p. 614 Summary Catalogue, vol. 4, p. 615

msItem.title: Characters of first eighteen days of the month in relation to good and ill fortune
Psalter/Hours and Calendar
msItem.note: (cuttings, see also MS. Douce d. 19 fols. 10-39)

decoDesc.decoNote: Fine borders, initial. (P&A i. 284, pl. XX)

msItem.title: Book of Hours
msItem.note: (fragment, see also MS. Douce d. 19 fol. 71v)

decoDesc.decoNote: Fine miniatures, borders, initials. (P&A i. 345, pl. XXVII)

history.origin:
15th century, third quarter
Flemish, Utrecht , or Dutch

decoDesc.decoNote: Good borders, historiated and other initials. (P&A i. 225)
Fine borders, historiated and other initials, mutilated. (P&A i. 363)
Seven important miniatures, partly unfinished. (P&A i. 536, pl. XLI)
Fine historiated initial. (P&A i. 852, pl. LXIII)
Good historiated initial, but retouched. (P&A ii 485, pl. LXVI)
Fine miniatures, borders, initials. By Maître François. (P&A i. 722, pl. LVI)
Fine historiated borders and initials. By the Master of the Dresden Hours. Script overpainted. (P&A i. 369)
Fine grisaille miniatures, borders, historiated and other initials. By the atelier of Willem Vrelant. (P&A i. 344)
